         The results of instrumental studies: ECG from.
         11/21/2006: Atrial fibrillation, heart rate = 88 in 1 min., normosystole, EOS sharply deviated
   to the left. Blockade of the anterior branch of the left leg of the bundle of His. Cicatricial changes in the anterior septum
         X-ray of the chest organs from 04.05.2006. Conclusion: the organs of the chest cavity without deviation
   ny from the
         norm. DUCHG from 05/06/2006: V ex 40.9 ml, K about 32.7%, T abbreviated 65 min, V with 0.5% / min. Conclusion: violation of
   contractile function of the gallbladder according to the hypomotor type.

         Treatment was carried out: regimen, diet, polarizing mixture with ascorbic acid, Riboxin IV No. 8, p
   latifillin 0.2% - 1 ml s / c 2-1 times a day, omeprazole 0.02 (1 tab 2 times a day), almagel (1 spoon 4 times
   a per day), novocaine 0.5% - 10 ml NaCl 0.9% - 100 ml IV No. 5, vit B6 IM 1 ml, vit B12 IM 600 mcg, Creon 10
   000 IU (1 dr 3 times a day 30 minutes before meals), allochol (2 tablets 3 times a day).

         Against the background of the therapy, the patient's condition improved, abdominal pain syndrome decreased.
   rated in intensity, frequency of occurrence, and duration.

         Recommended:
         1. Observation of a therapist (gastroenterologist).
         2. Omeprazole 0.02 (1 tab 2 times a day, morning and evening) - 1 week, then 1 tab at night - 2 weeks.

         3. Almagel A or Maalox (1 spoon 4 times a day an hour after meals and at night) - 3 weeks 4. Pancitrate
         (creon) - 1 capsule 3 times a day, with meals - 1 week, then 1 capsule 2 times a day
   day (morning and evening) - 2 weeks, then 1 capsule in the afternoon - 1 week.
         5. Hymecromon (odeston) 200 mg (1 tab 3 times a day) - 30 minutes before meals - 3 weeks 6.
         Complete blood count - after 3 weeks

    Does not require sick leave. Discharged in a satisfactory condition.

   sufficiency of the third functional class. Dyscirculatory encephalopathy of the first stage is mixed

   steochondrosis of the thoracic, lumbar spine with a slight dysfunction. Chronic
   vertebrogenic lumbosacral sciatica with L5-S1 with radicular syndrome in remission. Chronic atrophic gastritis in
   remission. Angioectasia of the stomach. prostate jelly adenoma
   PS Partial secondary adentia.

    MILITARY-MEDICAL ACADEMY. HOSPITAL THERAPY CLINIC Reference No.

         (53 years old), was examined and treated at the hospital therapy clinic of the Military Medical Academy with a
   diagnosis of Chronic gastroduodenitis in remission. Dolichocolon. Myopia of both eyes 1.25D with visual acuity
   1.0 correction for both eyes.

        The clinic was admitted in a planned manner with complaints of recurrent cutting pains in the epigastric region
   and along the colon, bloating, loosening of the stool; subfebrile body temperature in those
   last month, headaches, periodic nosebleeds that occur against the background of
   yoma blood pressure up to 150/90 mm. rt. Art.

        Results of laboratory researches:
   General analysis of blood, urine, feces dated 12/12/2006 was normal. Biochemical parameters of blood (AST, urea,
    creatinine, glucose, creatinine phosphokinase, total protein, total bilirubin, K+, Na+, Cl-, lipase) from 28.11
   .2006 is normal. Antibodies to HIV 1.2 from 11/30/2006 were not found. 04/09/2006 HbsAg, antibodies to HCV n
   e found. 04/08/2006 CRP - 0. RW microreaction-precipitation with cardiolipin antigen from 28.
   11.2006 - negative. RSK with chlamydial antigen from 29.11.2006 was negative. RNGA with tuberculosis
   ezny antigen, with dysentery antigens of Shigella (Zone, Flexner, Newcastle), with complex salm
   oneleous antigen, with pseudotuberculous antigen, yersinia antigen from 11/30/2006 - negative
   body. ECG dated April 27, 2006, sinus rhythm, heart rate 50 beats per minute. Incomplete blockade of the right leg of the pu
   chka Gisa. Initial manifestations of left ventricular hypertrophy. Anterior rotation of the heart with the right ventricle
   e. Ultrasound of the abdominal organs from 11/30/2006: the liver is not enlarged, the right lobe is 13.5 cm, the left
   lobe is 7.5 cm, the contours are even, the structure is homogeneous, the vessels are not dilated, the portal and hepatic vein
   nocturnal bile ducts without features. The gallbladder is not enlarged, the contours are even, the walls are thin, so
   the material is homogeneous, calculi and polyps are not visualized. Pancreas, spleen without
   bennosti. The kidneys are not enlarged, mobile. The parenchyma is homogeneous, without signs of pathology. cavity si
   stem is not expanded. No pathological formations were found in the projection of the adrenal glands. The spleen is not
   personal, homogeneous structure. X-ray examination of the chest organs from 02.10.2006: no pathological
   some changes. FCC dated 12/11/2006: the apparatus was inserted 20 cm from the anus. Further research is
   schenno because of inadequate behavior of the patient and at his urgent request. On the inspected area kish
   ki mucosa is thinned, the vascular pattern is enhanced. In the lumen fluid with an admixture of feces. Ampoule
   and the rectum without features. RRS dated 12/15/2006: the tube of the proctoscope was inserted up to 15 cm. Due to inadequat
   behavior of the patient, the study was not completed. In the rectum of organic pathology

   not found. The mucosa is pink, shiny, a vascular pattern is traced. intestinal tone with

   shades are normal. FGDS from 8.12.2006: The esophagus is passable, the socket of the cardia does not close completely. Into the stomac
   ke a significant amount of mucus, liquid (foamy with an admixture of bile). The folds are rough, edematous, tortuous
   s. The mucosa is hyperemic. The pylorus gapes, there is a reflux of duodenal contents (thick,
    viscous bile) In the duodenal bulb and postbulbar section, the mucosa is edematous, moderate
   but hyperemic.

         Treatment was carried out: regimen, diet, omeprazole 0.02 (1 tab 2 times a day), Almagel (1 spoon 4 times a day).
   ut), Creon 10,000 IU (1 dr 3 times a day 30 minutes before meals), allochol (2 tablets 3 times a day).

         On the background of the therapy, the patient's condition improved. Certified by VVK. Recognized on the basis
   on the formation of articles in column III of the Schedule of Diseases and TDT (annex to the Regulations on the military medical exp
   ize, approved by the Decree of the Government of the Russian Federation of 2003 No. 123) "A" - fit for military service.

         Recommended:
         1. Observation of a therapist (gastroenterologist).
         2. Omeprazole 0.02 (1 tab 2 times a day, morning and evening) - 1 week, then 1 tab at night - 2 weeks.

         3. Almagel A or Maalox (1 spoon 4 times a day one hour after meals and at night) - 3 weeks

    Does not require sick leave. Discharged in a satisfactory condition.

    Complaints of headaches, dizziness, unsteadiness when walking, numbness in the fingers of the upper extremities.
tei.

    Neurological status: conscious, oriented. Pupils D=S, physiological reflexes of pupils SN
zheny, the reaction of accommodation with convergence is reduced. There is no nystagmus. The face is
symmetrical. Tongue in the midline. Swallowing, phonation are not disturbed. Reflexes of oral automatism are negative
flexes D=S, functional areas expanded. There are no pathological signs. Decreased sensitivity in
lower limbs by radicular type (C5-C6, C6-C7). Performs coordination tests with easy inter
ntion. He staggers in the Romberg pose. There are no meningeal signs.

    Diagnosis: Dyscirculatory encephalopathy of the first stage of mixed (atherosclerotic, hypertension
cerebellar) genesis in the form of cerebellar insufficiency. Widespread osteochondrosis of the spine.

     REG dated 18.09.03: blood flow is slightly reduced in the basin of the carotid and vertebral arteries, symmetrical
en. The cerebrovascular tone is normal. The hyperventilation test is weakly positive. The elasticity of the
vessels is moderately reduced. Venous outflow is difficult in the vertebrobasilar basin.

MILITARY-MEDICAL ACADEMY. CLINIC OF HOSPITAL THERAPY Discharge summary No.

      born in 1960 (48 years old), was under examination and treatment in the hospital therapy clinic of the Military Medical Academy sin

 diagnosis:

     Systemic lupus erythematosus, a chronic progressive course with skin lesions ("butterfly", syn

Raynaud's syndrome, ecchymosis), joints (arthralgia, osteoporosis of small joints of the hands), myocardium (myocardiol

rofia), lymphadenopathy, mild secondary hypochromic anemia, leukopenia; secondary Itsenko-Cushing's syndrome, active phase
with a moderate (II) degree of activity, FNS-I, DN-0. Symptomatic art
serial hypertension (AH-2 Risk-3). Ischemic

     heart disease, angina pectoris of the first functional class, atherosclerosis of ao
mouths and coronary arteries, atherosclerotic cardiosclerosis with arrhythmias of the type of paroxysmal
oh form of atrial fibrillation. Mitral valve insufficiency of the first degree. Circulatory failure of the first stage. Chronic heart failure of
the second functional class. Dyscirculatory encephalopathy of the first stage of mixed (atherosclerotic, hypertensive)

genesis in the form of cerebellar insufficiency.
     Osteochondrosis of the cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine with a slight violation of fu

spine functions.

     Chronic erosive gastritis in the acute phase. Sliding hernia of the esophageal part of the diaphragm with
mixed type (axial and paraesophageal), secondary reflux esophagitis of the 2nd degree. Gastroptosis stage I
 Polyp of the gallbladder. Partial secondary adentia. Lateral pharyngitis. Chronic compensated
and tonsillitis.

     Simple myopic astigmatism of the direct type in 1.0 D, hypertensive angiopathy of the retina in both eyes. Subserous uterine
     fibroids of small size, cicatricial deformity of the cervix, bilateral fibroids

cystic mastopathy.


       She was admitted to the clinic for urgent indications with complaints of dull diffuse headache,
  dizziness, rise in blood pressure to 170/100 mm Hg, chest discomfort with irradiation to the left arm
  with slight physical exertion, shortness of breath, palpitations; heartburn, belching sour, nausea,
  vomiting; soreness in the shoulder, knee, ankle, small joints of the hands and feet, itching of the skin
  of the face, hands, forearms, hyperemia of the back and wings of the nose, swelling of the face in the
  morning; weight gain, general weakness; internal discomfort and feeling of lack of air mainly at night;
  dull aching pain in the lumbar region.

        Anamnesis morbi: She fell ill acutely in November 2005, when, against the background of relative
  well-being, severe morning stiffness, soreness, redness and swelling appeared in the area of small
  joints of both hands, shoulder, elbow and knee joints, fever up to 400C, sweating, severe general
  weakness pain, fast fatigue. On November 14, she was examined by a general practitioner, and a
  course of anti-inflammatory therapy (diclofenac retard, prednisone 30 mg/day) was prescribed, which
  resulted in a significant improvement in her state of health. In view of the deterioration of her condition
  in January 2006, she was hospitalized at military unit 25515 with a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis,
  seropositive, articular form. She received cytostatic therapy with methotrexate, mini-pulse therapy
  with methylprednisolone, movalis, physiotherapy with a positive effect. Further, against the background
  of outpatient cytostatic therapy (methotrexate 7.5 mg/week, predn isolon 10 mg/day) for the next three
  months felt satisfactorily. In May 2006, against the background of constant use of methotrexate,
  prednisolone and bathing, pain, heaviness in the epigastric region and nausea after taking medications,
  in the left and right hypochondria appeared, and therefore she independently refused to take
  medications. Against the background of refusal of treatment, pain in the joints intensified, pains in the
  right elbow joint joined, subfibrile fever appeared. She resumed taking medications again without a
  positive effect. 26.06.06 For urgent indications, she was hospitalized in the rheumatology department
  of the Medical Unit of OAO NLMK, where she was diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus for
  the first time. She received treatment: methotrexate 10 mg/week, prednisolone 20 mg/day, movalis,
  chimes, pentoxifylline, physiotherapy with a positive effect. However, against the background of
  constant intake of these drugs, at the end of October 2006, pain in the joints increased again,
  hyperemia of the back of the nose and cheeks appeared, itching of the skin of the face, hands, swelling
  on the face and hands, periodic pain behind the sternum and in the left half of the chest, palpitations ,
  shortness of breath with little physical exertion, general weakness, pain in the mouth, aching pain in
  the lumbar region after physical exertion and a decrease in the dose of prednisolone taken a. Stationary
  held a course of plasmapheresis and plasmasorption, pulse therapy with methylprednisolone. After
  this course of therapy for the next 6 months, while taking 10 mg of prednisolone and 7.5 mg of
  methotrexate, she felt well. Exacerbations of the disease were noted in October-November 2007 and
  February-March 2007 and 2008, however, an increase in the dose of prednisolone to 80 mg/day for 3
  weeks, followed by a gradual decrease in the dose to 15-40 mg/day, made it possible to stop
   exacerbations. Annually, she underwent planned inpatient treatment for the underlying disease, where
  the dose of the drugs taken was adjusted. The last exacerbation of the disease was noted in September
   2008. In the day hospital regime, the following treatment was carried out: regimen, diet, intravenous
  injection: pulse therapy "Solu-medrol" 1000 mg (18.09.08 and 19.09.2008), asparkam, cardionat,
  cytoflavin and Riboxin No. 5, Neoton 4g No. 2, Vitamins: C, B1, Trental No. 3, Cerebrolysis No. 1,
  Piracetam No. 3, Prednisolone 40 mg in the morning, Methotrexate 10 mg / week. After the therapy, a
  short-term improvement in well-being was noted, however, from mid-October, the condition
  progressively worsened in the form of discomfort behind the sternum with irradiation to the left arm
  and shortness of breath with little physical exertion (rise to the 1st floor), palpitations, heartburn, sour
  belching, nausea , pain in the shoulder, knee, ankle, small joints of the hands, feet, swelling of the face
  in the morning, general weakness, internal discomfort and itching of the skin of the face, forearms,
  hands, as well as a feeling of lack of air mainly at night, hyperemia back and wings of the nose.
  Increasing the dose of methotrexate taken up to 15 mg/week and prednisolone up to 40 mg/day did
  not lead to the desired result. The existing complaints, despite the intake of omeprazole and almagel
  for the purpose of gastroprotection, were joined by pain in the epigastric region, heartburn, sour
  belching, nausea, episodic vomiting after taking medications, progressively increasing general
  weakness, numbness in the fingers and toes. On an outpatient basis in the polyclinic in the general
   blood test, signs of a mild degree of normochromic anemia were revealed, laboratory data for the
  activity of the process (increased ESR, CRP) were not noted, and therefore hospitalization in the rheumatolo

   oliprel 2mg in the morning). For the first time, systolic murmur over the apex of the heart appeared in 2006,
  with time its intensity increased. Episodic pain in the epigastric region notes for ten years, was treated
  independently with a temporary positive effect. Over the past two years, sh
   stiffness when walking, numbness in the fingers of the upper limbs, not treated, no medical help

    greeted.

   Technical commentary on the study 11/15/2006: Antibodies to the
   common extractable nuclear antigen of antibodies to SS-A antigen 60 kDa were found Antit
   ate to Ro / SS-A antigen with a mass of 60 kDa are relatively more often detected in patients with SLE than in patients with III syndrome
   ogren and skin forms. Antibodies to the 60 kDa Ro/SS-A antigen are relatively more frequently detected in more
   ny SLE than in Sjogren's syndrome and cutaneous primary skin lesions, secondary dry syndrome, photosensitivity and articular
   syndrome. A dangerous manifestation of SLE associated with ant
   antibodies against Ro / SS-A 60 kDa, is a syndrome of congenital lupus that develops in newborns
    from women in labor with SLE. The basis of this disease is the penetration into the blood of a newborn
   placenta anti-Ro/SS-A antibodies. The main manifestation of congenital lupus is dermatosis and lesions.
   internal organs, including congenital transverse AV block, hepatitis, hemolytic anemia
   and thrombocytopenia. Anti-dsDNA antibodies are the main serological marker of SLE with lesions
   m of the kidneys, since they are involved in the pathogenesis of lupus nephritis, in addition, they are included in the 10th criterion of SLE.
   low titers of antibodies to DNA without concomitant ANF and antibodies to an extractable nuclear antigen can be observed
   against the background of viral and infectious diseases and are not detected in isolated detection.
   are a sign of SLE. There is a relationship between the increase in titers of antinuclear factor (AN
   F), antibodies to dsDNA and hypocomplementemia before the development of an exacerbation of SLE, which requires periodic
   determination of antibody titers to dsDNA and the level of complement factors C3 and C4 in all SLE patients with frequencies
   oh once every 3-6 months.

     Recommended: 20. Outpatient observation of a rheumatologist. 21. Annual

     Frequency of observations by a rheumatologist: - 4 times a year. b. Examination

      year, with a biopsy of dubious areas of the lower third of the esophagus. When a recognition is detected

  Barrett's esophagus (the presence of gastric metaplasia of the mucosa of the esophagus proximal to 2.5 s
  m from the gastroesophageal junction) ­ consultation of an abdominal surgeon

     i. Dental consultation and oral hygiene 23.
     Lifestyle changes: a. Exclusion of a strictly
     horizontal position during sleep (raise the head end of the bed by 15

   cm) b. Exclusion of wearing corsets, bandages, tight
     belts c. Exclusion of weight lifting more than 4-5 kg, work related to the tilt of the body forward, physical

   exercises associated with overstrain of the abdominal muscles (including yoga classes) 24.
     Changing the mode and nature of nutrition: a. Avoid overeating, snacking, eating at night, lying
     down after eating b. Exclude from the diet foods rich in fat (whole milk, cream, oily fish, goose,
     duck, pork

  nina, fatty beef, lamb, cakes, pastries), drinks containing caffeine (coffee, strong tea, coca
  -cola), chocolate, products containing mint and pepper, citrus fruits, tomatoes, onions, garlic, fried foods.

     c. Do not use alcoholic drinks, carbonated mineral water d. Limit
     consumption of butter and margarine e. 5 meals a day in small
     portions with a high protein content f. Eat at least 3 hours before bedtime, after eating
     take a 30-minute walk. 25. Continue taking: a. Prednisolone 5mg - 4 tab. in the morning with breakfast
     until 9 am ­ all the time b. Methotrexate 2.5 mg - 1 tab. 3 times a week (Saturday morning and evening
     1 tab, Sunday morning 1 tab) - constantly

     at least 6 months. d. Ca-D3-Nycomed-forte - 1 tab. in the evening daily e. Multivitamin
     preparations: "Complivit" 1 tablet daily for 3 months f. Sorbifer durules - 1 capsule

   a gadfly of repeated exacerbations of systemic lupus erythematosus with a moderate

    i.

        A real deterioration in health occurred on the afternoon of 10/19/2014, when, while taking nitrospray for
  pain in the left side of the chest, the patient lost consciousness (the duration of syncope is unknown).
  on the). The patient refused from the hospitalization offered by the arriving ambulance team. Takes regularly
   phenobarbital for epilepsy (dose in the last day is unknown). On the morning of January 20, 2014 appeared sickeni
  yeah, vomit. Social transport delivered to the hospital therapy clinic VMedA. During the survey
  establishing convincing data for acute coronary syndrome (chest pain the day before and admission according to t
  a gadfly of nitrospray) was not obtained (chest pain was regarded as thoracalgia of non-cardiac origin). Loss of cos

  increased attention to the expressed cerebral symptoms. The main severity of the condition at the time of th
  hospitalization 20.01.2014 caused cerebral symptoms, within which the differential was carried out
  Rational-diagnostic search between acute cerebrovascular accident in vertebrobasil
  swimming pool and poisoning (overdose) of antiepileptic drugs (phenobarbital). Taking into account the
  obtained MRI data (according to sito), the results of a toxicological blood test for barbiturates,
  The patient had toxic encephalopathy due to an overdose of barbiturates. For the purpose of conducting
  detoxification therapy, the patient urgently agreed with the leadership of the department during
  field therapy was transferred to a specialized toxicological department of resuscitation and intensive care
  ive therapy of the VPT clinic, where complex detoxification therapy was carried out. On stabilization of the
  state on 21.01.2014. at 18:30 she was again admitted to the hospital therapy clinic by transfer from the ICU. In
  the course of the examination, it was found that diseases of the internal organs are compensated
  ny character and do not need additional correction of the therapy. The pathology of the central nervous
  system is dominant in the picture of the disease, which does not require urgent medical attention.
  interference and the patient can undergo further treatment on an outpatient basis.

  denies the action and febrile patients. Hepatitis C since 2010 (according to the patient).

  th amount (50-100 g) of vegetable oil. Tea or coffee can be acidified with lemon, put 2-3 tablespoons

  carbohydrates and fats and dosed - proteins. Calculating the daily amount of protein in the diet is a must.
  telny. It is allowed to replace 1 egg with: cottage cheese - 40 g; meat - 35 g; fish - 50 g; milk - 160 g; cheese - 2

     EXECUTIVE SUMMARY No.

     born 1989 was on inpatient examination and treatment at the clinic of hospital therapy of the Military Medical
Academy from January 29, 2014 to February 18, 2014 with a diagnosis of Acute infectious myocarditis with rhythm

     disturbance of the type of frequently recurrent focal
atrial tachycardia, heart failure of the first functional class.

     Chronic periodontitis 16, 24, 46 teeth. Chronic odontogenic osteomyelitis of the lower jaw from
 37 tooth, chronic periodontitis 16 tooth (extraction of 16 and 37 teeth on 31.01.2014). Retention 28, 48 teeth.

     Deviation of the nasal septum. ARVI by type of rhinopharyngitis, residual effects.

Final diagnosis established Clinical  ICD code I 40.0 MES 291030 ICD
outcome: improvement.                                                    code K 10.2 MES 331140

    Certificate of incapacity for work: issued from 29.01.2014. to 18.02.2014 Coming to work February 19, 2013 LN y124
744 788 005.

     Complaints at admission: pronounced palpitations, dizziness, moderate general
yu weakness, discomfort in the precordial region.

     During the last month, against the background of a protracted episode of acute respiratory disease, she began to
notice the daily occurrence of palpitations without a visible provocative situation with a clear

beginning lasting up to an hour, stages of "warming up", "plateau" and "cooling down"; progressive increase

 general weakness, fatigue, the appearance of constant discomfort in the precordial region, subfebrile
fever. Independently consulted a neurologist (healthy), an endocrinologist (thyrotoxicosis and
switched off). On the night of January 28-29, she noted a progressive increase in severe weakness, dizzy
ia, nausea, the appearance of signs of pre-syncope. Arrived at the scene by an ambulance brigade
Qing aid was provided with emergency measures, taken to the admission department of the Military Medical Academy,
where about 30 minutes ago, against the background of relative well-being, another heart attack developed, he

         24-hour ECG monitoring from May 31, 2010: sinus
    rhythm with heart rate from 47 to 170 in 1 minute. The decrease in heart rate at night is adequate. Average heart rate 84/85/62 per minute. Z
   registered single ventricular extrasystoles (2); solitary supraventricular, periodically
   severe (from 13:00 to 14:00 - 103 extrasystoles; from 15:00 to 17:00 - 101 extrasystoles; in total 263 per day), with episodic
   ladies by the type of bi- and trigeminy. At 21:25 a single episode of transient av-blockade of the 2nd step was registered
   nor 2 types (Mobitz 2) with a pause of 2 sec. When performing the planned load, the heart rate reached 166 and 170 in 1 minute
   , subjectively noted the heartbeat. Ischemic changes in the ST segment were not detected.

          24-hour blood pressure monitoring from May 31, 2010: the study was performed against the background of antihypertensive thera
   PII (amlodipine, enalapril). Mean systolic BP in the daytime is typical for mild labile hypertension, at night the average
   systolic BP is within the normal range. Mean diastolic BP in days
   night time is typical for mild stable hypertension, at night - for moderate stable hypertension
   pertension. At night, systolic and diastolic blood pressure fall adequately (dipper). System variability
   olic and diastolic blood pressure during the day within the acceptable range. There is an increase in
   s of the morning rise in diastolic blood pressure, the speed of the morning rise in systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

       This block includes a number of mental disorders grouped together in relation to the presence of
  other etiological factors, namely, the cause of these disorders were brain diseases, injuries
  a brain or stroke leading to cerebral dysfunction. Dysfunction may be primary (to
  as in diseases, brain injuries and strokes that directly or selectively affect the head
  brain) and secondary (as in systemic diseases or disorders where the brain is involved
  I am in the pathological process along with other organs and systems).

       Dementia [dementia] (F00-F03) is a syndrome caused by damage to the brain (usually chronic
  of a progressive or progressive nature), in which many higher cortical functions are disturbed, including
  including memory thinking, orientation, understanding, counting, learning ability, speech and judgment. conscious
  it's not darkened. Decreased cognitive function is usually accompanied, and sometimes preceded, by worsen
  lack of control over emotions, social behavior or motivation. This syndrome is observed in diseases
  and Alzheimer's, in cerebrovascular diseases and in other conditions, primary or secondary lesions
  brain.

       If necessary, an additional code is used to identify the underlying disease.

     MEDICAL ACADEMY Hospital Therapy Clinic
     Discharge summary from case history No. 1033

     was on examination and treatment in the clinic of hospital therapy VMedA from 06.11.2009 to 20.11.
2009

     DIAGNOSIS:
     coronary artery disease, stable exertional angina 3 FC. Atherosclerotic cardiosclerosis. Atherosclerosis of the aor
you and the coronary arteries. Paroxysmal form of atrial fibrillation, paroxysm of atrial fibrillation
diy dated 08.11.09. stopped medically on 08.11.09.
     Hypertension III degree. (AH 2, CVE risk is extremely high). NK 2a st., 3 FC. Dyscirculatory
     encephalopathy stage 3 mixed (atherosclerotic, hypertensive) genesis
and with a predominant lesion in the vertebrobasilar basin. Intellectual-mnestic syndrome
their violations.
     Osteochondrosis of the thoracic spine with pain syndrome. Cholelithiasis.
     Chronic calculous cholecystitis without exacerbation. Omission of the right kidney 1
     degree. Varicose disease of the lower extremities, CVI-2st.

     Upon admission, she complained of recurrent pressing pains in the region of the heart, of varying duration.
tensions that arise after climbing to the 2nd floor, stopping on their own after the cessation of physical
load; periodic heartbeats, interruptions in the work of the heart; episodic increase in blood pressure up to 1
80\90 mm Hg, pain in the spine, aggravated by physical activity, weight loss of 5 kg during
years, memory loss, fatigue.

     The results of instrumental studies: X-ray of the
     chest organs No. 2590 dated 09.11.09: on the chest radiograph and at p
fluoroscopy, the pulmonary fields are emphysematous, at the level of the 2nd rib on the left, areas of limited
pneumofibrosis 1.5 * 1.0 cm. The roots are structural, not expanded, the diaphragm is flattened, free fluid in the
pleural cavity is not determined. The heart is slightly dilated to the left. Aorta compacted and expanded

and.

     X-ray of the thoracic spine No. 2681 dated 11/17/09. in 2 projections - physiological kyphosis is enhanced
(senile round back). Osteochondrosis in the mid-thoracic region with a decrease in disc height
ov, osteochondral sclerosis and marginal exophytes in direct projection up to 0.1 cm.

     diagnosis:

        Systemic lupus erythematosus, a chronic progressive course with skin lesions ("butterfly", syn
   Raynaud's syndrome, ecchymosis), joints (arthralgia, osteoporosis of small joints of the hands), myocardium (myocardiologist
   rofia), lymphadenopathy, mild secondary hypochromic anemia, leukopenia; secondary Itsenko-Cushing's syndrome, active phase
   with a moderate (II) degree of activity, FNS-I, DN-0. Symptomatic art
   serial hypertension (AH-2 Risk-3). Ischemic

        heart disease, angina pectoris of the first functional class, atherosclerosis of ao
   mouths and coronary arteries, atherosclerotic cardiosclerosis with arrhythmias of the type of paroxysmal
   oh form of atrial fibrillation. Mitral valve insufficiency of the first degree. Circulatory failure of the first stage. Chronic heart failure of
   the second functional class. Dyscirculatory encephalopathy of the first stage of mixed (atherosclerotic, hypertensive)

   genesis in the form of cerebellar insufficiency.
        Osteochondrosis of the cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine with a slight violation of fu

    spine functions.

        Chronic erosive gastritis in the acute phase. Sliding hernia of the esophageal part of the diaphragm with
   mixed type (axial and paraesophageal), secondary reflux esophagitis of the 2nd degree. Gastroptosis stage I
    Polyp of the gallbladder. Partial secondary adentia. Lateral pharyngitis. Chronic compensated
   and tonsillitis.

        Simple myopic astigmatism of the direct type in 1.0 D, hypertensive angiopathy of the retina in both eyes. Subserous uterine
        fibroids of small size, cicatricial deformity of the cervix, bilateral fibroids


     cystic mastopathy.

       She was admitted to the clinic for urgent indications with complaints of dull diffuse headache,
  dizziness, rise in blood pressure to 170/100 mm Hg, chest discomfort with irradiation to the left arm
  with slight physical exertion, shortness of breath, palpitations; heartburn, belching sour, nausea,
  vomiting; soreness in the shoulder, knee, ankle, small joints of the hands and feet, itching of the skin
  of the face, hands, forearms, hyperemia of the back and wings of the nose, swelling of the face in the
  morning; weight gain, general weakness; internal discomfort and feeling of lack of air mainly at night;
  dull aching pain in the lumbar region.

        Anamnesis morbi: She fell ill acutely in November 2005, when, against the background of relative
  well-being, severe morning stiffness, soreness, redness and swelling appeared in the area of small
  joints of both hands, shoulder, elbow and knee joints, fever up to 400C, sweating, severe general
  weakness pain, fast fatigue. On November 14, she was examined by a general practitioner, and a
  course of anti-inflammatory therapy (diclofenac retard, prednisone 30 mg/day) was prescribed, which
  resulted in a significant improvement in her state of health. In view of the deterioration of her condition
  in January 2006, she was hospitalized at military unit 25515 with a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis,
  seropositive, articular form. She received cytostatic therapy with methotrexate, mini-pulse therapy
  with methylprednisolone, movalis, physiotherapy with a positive effect. Further, against the background
  of outpatient cytostatic therapy (methotrexate 7.5 mg/week, predn isolon 10 mg/day) for the next three
  months felt satisfactorily. In May 2006, against the background of constant use of methotrexate,
  prednisolone and bathing, pain, heaviness in the epigastric region and nausea after taking medications,
  in the left and right hypochondria appeared, and therefore she independently refused to take
  medications. Against the background of refusal of treatment, pain in the joints intensified, pains in the
  right elbow joint joined, subfibrile fever appeared. She resumed taking medications again without a
  positive effect. 26.06.06 For urgent indications, she was hospitalized in the rheumatology department
  of the Medical Unit of OAO NLMK, where she was diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus for
  the first time. She received treatment: methotrexate 10 mg/week, prednisolone 20 mg/day, movalis,
  chimes, pentoxifylline, physiotherapy with a positive effect. However, against the background of
  constant intake of these drugs, at the end of October 2006, pain in the joints increased again,
  hyperemia of the back of the nose and cheeks appeared, itching of the skin of the face, hands, swelling
  on the face and hands, periodic pain behind the sternum and in the left half of the chest, palpitations ,
  shortness of breath with little physical exertion, general weakness, pain in the mouth, aching pain in
  the lumbar region after physical exertion and a decrease in the dose of prednisolone taken a. Stationary
  held a course of plasmapheresis and plasmasorption, pulse therapy with methylprednisolone. After
  this course of therapy for the next 6 months, while taking 10 mg of prednisolone and 7.5 mg of
  methotrexate, she felt well. Exacerbations of the disease were noted in October-November 2007 and
  February-March 2007 and 2008, however, an increase in the dose of prednisolone to 80 mg/day for 3
  weeks, followed by a gradual decrease in the dose to 15-40 mg/day, made it possible to stop
   exacerbations. Annually, she underwent planned inpatient treatment for the underlying disease, where
  the dose of the drugs taken was adjusted. The last exacerbation of the disease was noted in September
   2008. In the day hospital regime, the following treatment was carried out: regimen, diet, intravenous
  injection: pulse therapy "Solu-medrol" 1000 mg (18.09.08 and 19.09.2008), asparkam, cardionat,
  cytoflavin and Riboxin No. 5, Neoton 4g No. 2, Vitamins: C, B1, Trental No. 3, Cerebrolysis No. 1,
  Piracetam No. 3, Prednisolone 40 mg in the morning, Methotrexate 10 mg / week. After the therapy, a
  short-term improvement in well-being was noted, however, from mid-October, the condition
  progressively worsened in the form of discomfort behind the sternum with irradiation to the left arm
  and shortness of breath with little physical exertion (rise to the 1st floor), palpitations, heartburn, sour
  belching, nausea , pain in the shoulder, knee, ankle, small joints of the hands, feet, swelling of the face
  in the morning, general weakness, internal discomfort and itching of the skin of the face, forearms,
  hands, as well as a feeling of lack of air mainly at night, hyperemia back and wings of the nose.
  Increasing the dose of methotrexate taken up to 15 mg/week and prednisolone up to 40 mg/day did
  not lead to the desired result. The existing complaints, despite the intake of omeprazole and almagel
  for the purpose of gastroprotection, were joined by pain in the epigastric region, heartburn, sour
  belching, nausea, episodic vomiting after taking medications, progressively increasing general weakness, n

  logical department in a planned manner.
   Over the past two years, he has noted an increase in blood pressure up to 170/110 mm Hg, accompanied by
  given by dizziness, nausea, palpitations. Takes antihypertensive drugs regularly
   oliprel 2mg in the morning). For the first time, systolic murmur over the apex of the heart appeared in 2006,
  with time its intensity increased. Episodic pain in the epigastric region notes for ten years, was treated
  independently with a temporary positive effect. Over the past two years, sh
   stiffness when walking, numbness in the fingers of the upper limbs, not treated, no medical help

    greeted.

   Technical commentary on the study 11/15/2006: Antibodies to the
   common extractable nuclear antigen of antibodies to SS-A antigen 60 kDa were found Antit
   ate to Ro / SS-A antigen with a mass of 60 kDa are relatively more often detected in patients with SLE than in patients with III syndrome
   ogren and skin forms. Antibodies to the 60 kDa Ro/SS-A antigen are relatively more frequently detected in more
   ny SLE than in Sjogren's syndrome and cutaneous primary skin lesions, secondary dry syndrome, photosensitivity and articular
   syndrome. A dangerous manifestation of SLE associated with ant
   antibodies against Ro / SS-A 60 kDa, is a syndrome of congenital lupus that develops in newborns
    from women in labor with SLE. The basis of this disease is the penetration into the blood of a newborn
   placenta anti-Ro/SS-A antibodies. The main manifestation of congenital lupus is dermatosis and lesions.
   internal organs, including congenital transverse AV block, hepatitis, hemolytic anemia
   and thrombocytopenia. Anti-dsDNA antibodies are the main serological marker of SLE with lesions
   m of the kidneys, since they are involved in the pathogenesis of lupus nephritis, in addition, they are included in the 10th criterion of SL
   low titers of antibodies to DNA without concomitant ANF and antibodies to an extractable nuclear antigen can be observed
   against the background of viral and infectious diseases and are not detected in isolated detection.
   are a sign of SLE. There is a relationship between the increase in titers of antinuclear factor (AN
   F), antibodies to dsDNA and hypocomplementemia before the development of an exacerbation of SLE, which requires periodic
   determination of antibody titers to dsDNA and the level of complement factors C3 and C4 in all SLE patients with frequencies
   oh once every 3-6

     Frequency of observations by a rheumatologist: - 4 times a year. b. Examination

     gastroenterologist - 1 time per year. c. clinical blood test (with counting of
     platelets and reticulocytes), urinalysis - 4-6 times a year; when changing the dose of
     cytostatic drugs - monthly control; d. biochemical blood test (fibrinogen, protein fractions, AST,
  ALT, total bilirubin, creat

  inin, urea) - at least 2 times a year;
     e. x-ray (fluorography) of the chest organs 2 times a year; x-ray of joints

  testimonies; f. blood test for the content of antinuclear factor and antibodies to double-stranded DNA and th

   compliment C3 and C4 - 3 times a year and during exacerbation.
      g. Echocardiography - 2 times a year; h. FGDS - 1 time per
      year, with a biopsy of dubious areas of the lower third of the esophagus. When a recognition is detected

  Barrett's esophagus (the presence of gastric metaplasia of the mucosa of the esophagus proximal to 2.5 s
  m from the gastroesophageal junction) ­ consultation of an abdominal surgeon

     i. Dental consultation and oral hygiene 135.
     Lifestyle changes: a. Exclusion of a strictly
     horizontal position during sleep (raise the head end of the bed by 15

   cm) b. Exclusion of wearing corsets, bandages, tight
     belts c. Exclusion of weight lifting more than 4-5 kg, work related to the tilt of the body forward, physical

   exercises associated with overstrain of the abdominal muscles (including yoga classes) 136.
     Changing the mode and nature of nutrition: a. Avoid overeating, snacking, eating at night,
     lying down after eating b. Exclude from the diet foods rich in fat (whole milk, cream, oily fish,
     goose, duck, pork

  nina, fatty beef, lamb, cakes, pastries), drinks containing caffeine (coffee, strong tea, coca
  -cola), chocolate, products containing mint and pepper, citrus fruits, tomatoes, onions, garlic, fried foods.

     c. Do not use alcoholic drinks, carbonated mineral water d. Limit
     consumption of butter and margarine e. 5 meals a day in small
     portions with a high protein content f. Eat at least 3 hours before bedtime, after
     eating take a 30-minute walk. 137. Continue taking: a. Prednisolone 5mg - 4 tab. in the morning
     with breakfast until 9 am ­ all the time b. Methotrexate 2.5 mg - 1 tab. 3 times a week (Saturday
     morning and evening 1 tab, Sunday morning 1 tab) - constantly

      c. Wobenzym - 5 tablets × 3 times a day × a month, then 3 tablets × 3 times a day - at least 6 months.
      d. Ca-D3-Nycomed-forte - 1 tab. in the evening daily e. Multivitamin preparations: "Complivit" 1
      tablet daily for 3 months f. Sorbifer durules - 1 capsule in the morning for 3 months g. Venter 0.5
      op 1 tab 1-1.5 hours after meals 4 times a day, if there is no effect - 8 times a day after 3 hours

     regardless of food

      h. Motilium - 10 mg in the morning 30 minutes before meals 1
      month i. Omeprazole 20mg - 1 capsule in the morning on an
     empty stomach for 1 month j. Maalox on demand

   residence in good condition.

   polyclinic therapist. 150. Exclude animal fats, fried, spicy,

   Disease history:
          She fell ill acutely in November 2005, when, against the background of relative well-being, severe morning stiffness,

        A real deterioration in health occurred on the afternoon of 10/19/2014, when, while taking nitrospray for
  pain in the left side of the chest, the patient lost consciousness (the duration of syncope is unknown).
  on the). The patient refused from the hospitalization offered by the arriving ambulance team. Takes regularly
   phenobarbital for epilepsy (dose in the last day is unknown). On the morning of January 20, 2014 appeared sickeni
  yeah, vomit. Social transport delivered to the hospital therapy clinic VMedA. During the survey
  establishing convincing data for acute coronary syndrome (chest pain the day before and admission according to t
  a gadfly of nitrospray) was not obtained (chest pain was regarded as thoracalgia of non-cardiac origin). Loss of cos
  on the eve, most likely due to orthostatic hypotension while taking nitrospray. About
  increased attention to the expressed cerebral symptoms. The main severity of the condition at the time of th
  hospitalization 20.01.2014 caused cerebral symptoms, within which the differential was carried out
  Rational-diagnostic search between acute cerebrovascular accident in vertebrobasil
  swimming pool and poisoning (overdose) of antiepileptic drugs (phenobarbital). Taking into account the
  obtained MRI data (according to sito), the results of a toxicological blood test for barbiturates,
  The patient had toxic encephalopathy due to an overdose of barbiturates. For the purpose of conducting
  detoxification therapy, the patient urgently agreed with the leadership of the department during
  field therapy was transferred to a specialized toxicological department of resuscitation and intensive care
  ive therapy of the VPT clinic, where complex detoxification therapy was carried out. On stabilization of the
  state on 21.01.2014. at 18:30 she was again admitted to the hospital therapy clinic by transfer from the ICU.

MILITARY MEDICAL ACADEMY

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

CASE HISTORY y, ARCHIVE y_________ Surname, name, patronymic born in 1962 He was treated

in the day hospital mode in the clinic of hospital therapy Total number of days of treatment was

16 The final diagnosis was established. DIAGNOSIS: Main disease: Arrhythmogenic dysplasia of

the right ventricle. Implanted cardioverter-d  ICD Code _I 42.8

efibrillator (2009) Atherosclerosis of the aorta and coronary arteries. Large focal myocarditis (19
95 g.) and atherosclerotic cardiosclerosis with persistent cardiac arrhythmia according to the type of frequent jelly
daughter extrasystole and paroxysmal polytopic ventricular tachycardia. Hypertensive disease
n the second stage (arterial hypertension 3, the risk of CVE is very high).

     Complications of the underlying disease: Chronic heart failure of the third functional
 class, stage I.

     Background disease: Diabetes mellitus type 2. Diabetic symmetrical distal polynea
sensory ropathy. Target HbA1c < 7.0% Comorbidities: Diffuse

     nodular goiter, without thyroid dysfunction. Disc
circulatory encephalopathy of the second stage of mixed genesis (atherosclerotic, hypertensive, diabetic
betic and vertebrogenic) in the form of scattered neurological symptoms and pronounced persistent ps
eudoneurotic syndrome. Chronic gastritis, stage of remission. Fatty hepatosis of the second stage, without
 dysfunction.

Certificate of incapacity for work: not issued
Total exposure dose 5.6 mSv Clinical outcome
(underline): recovery, improvement, no changes, chronicity, disability, _____ disability group, degree of limitation
Outcome: discharged due to improvement

      Complaints: pressing pains behind the sternum that occur during physical exertion, sensations of interruptions in ra
heart beat, episodes of palpitations, shortness of breath when climbing to the second floor, walking up to 200 meters, headac
ol spilled nature, dizziness with an increase in blood pressure to 160/110 mm. rt. st., ra
more than 130/80 mm. rt. Art., general weakness, fatigue, irritability, memory loss,

sleep disturbance, periodic dry mouth and thirst, heartburn with errors in the diet.

      History of present illness. Since childhood, he often suffered from tonsillitis. In 1985, he was diagnosed with

   onic tonsillitis, for which he was treated on an outpatient and inpatient basis. In 1995, after moving
   ny angina developed infectious-allergic myocarditis, which proceeded with severe violations of the heart rhythm and
   conduction. Subsequently, myocardial cardiosclerosis was formed with impaired
   conduction in the form of a complete blockade of the right leg of the bundle of His, blockade of the anterior branch of the left leg
   and bundle of His. In the future, he was repeatedly treated for this in a hospital. Since 1999 worries about odes
   The scale during physical activity, during a stationary examination, heart failure of the first functional class was verified.
   Since 2000, they have been worried about interruptions in the work of the heart, frequent ventricular
   new extrasystole. Since 2004, they began to worry about pressing pains behind the sternum during physical exertion, st
   ischemic heart disease, angina pectoris of the first functional
   about the class, a constant intake of nitrates, antiplatelet agents is recommended, the patient complied with these recommendati
   yal partially. In August 2008, hemodynamically significant paroxysm of ventricular tachycardia took place.

in the lower lobe of the left lung, severe, left-sided effusion pleurisy. Cholelithiasis

go to the hospitals of the city, where complex treatment with active diuretic therapy was carried out. After issue

claims from the pulmonology department of City Hospital No. 26, his condition deteriorated sharply. From 23.12.10 to 14.01.11 pas

she was treated at the GT VMedA clinic. In view of the resistance of pathological exudation in the right pleural

cavity to diuretic therapy and mechanical removal of fluid during pleural punctures, the gnostic patient was           in dia

recommended to perform a CT scan in order to exclude a neoplasm of the right leg

whom, mediastinum, abdominal organs. When trying to perform a tomography, the study turned out to be

   aCl 0.9%-200.0, Sol.Asparcami 20 ml), inotropic therapy (Korglikon 0.06% 1.0 IV drip, Digoxin 0.00

  shortness of breath decreased, cough regressed, swelling on the legs disappeared, a small amount of fluid remained
  bones in the supraphrenic portions of the right lung.

       This block includes a number of mental disorders grouped together in relation to the presence of
  other etiological factors, namely, the cause of these disorders were brain diseases, injuries
  a brain or stroke leading to cerebral dysfunction. Dysfunction may be primary (to
  as in diseases, brain injuries and strokes that directly or selectively affect the head
  brain) and secondary (as in systemic diseases or disorders where the brain is involved
  I am in the pathological process along with other organs and systems).

       Dementia [dementia] (F00-F03) is a syndrome caused by damage to the brain (usually chronic
  of a progressive or progressive nature), in which many higher cortical functions are disturbed, including
  including memory thinking, orientation, understanding, counting, learning ability, speech and judgment. conscious
  it's not darkened. Decreased cognitive function is usually accompanied, and sometimes preceded, by worsen
  lack of control over emotions, social behavior or motivation. This syndrome is observed in diseases
  and Alzheimer's, in cerebrovascular diseases and in other conditions, primary or secondary lesions
  brain.

       If necessary, an additional code is used to identify the underlying disease.

   XVIII. DISCUSSION REPORT CASE
   HISTORY y: ARCHIVE y: SURNAME, FIRST
   NAME, PATRONYMIC NAME: Date of birth: full
   years: 50 Contingent: Pensioners of the Ministry
   of Defense of the Russian Federation Inpatient
   treatment: Department of Hospital Therapy of the Military Medical Academy from: 21.04.2016 to: 25.04.2016 in total
   days of treatment: 4

        Final diagnosis:
   Atherosclerosis of the aorta. Large-focal myocardial cardiosclerosis with outcome in secondary dilatation
   this cardiomyopathy. Secondary mitral insufficiency of the 2nd degree, tricuspid insufficiency
   b 2nd degree, secondary pulmonary hypertension of 3rd degree. Frequent ventricular extrasystole, paroxysmal
   naya unstable ventricular tachycardia. Persistent form of atrial fibrillation. RFA pulmonary
   th veins and cava-tricuspid isthmus 04.2012; 30.07.2014 - RFA of arrhythmogenic zones of the left and right
   o atrial using a circular diagnostic electrode (Lasso) in the conditions of an electroanatomist
   ical mapping Carto XP. Paroxysm of atrial fibrillation from 04/21/2016. (tachysystolic in
   variant, CHA2DS2VASc 2.2% [2 points], EHRA grade 4, HAS-BLED 2 points) complicated by the development of arrhythmi
   gene shock, interstitial pulmonary edema, stopped by EIT (200 J) on 21.04.2016. Chronic
   heart failure stage 2B, 4-3 functional class.

   Bronchial asthma, atopic, mild, intermittent course in the stage of stable remission

   Urolithiasis, microliths of both kidneys, remission, without impaired renal excretory function. AT
   toric nephropathy due to chronic heart failure. Diffuse nephroangiosclerosis. Chronic kidney disease stage 3aA1.
   Secondary chronic iron deficiency anemia of mild degree. Chronic gastritis without exacerbation. Alimentary obesity
   of the first degree, stable stage. Intervertebral osteochondrosis of the cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine. Varicose
   disease of the lower extremities without signs of venous insufficiency. Hyperopia 0.5 D in both eyes.

        Total radiation dose: 0.26 mSv Clinical
        outcome: Dropped out with improvement On
        admission: Complaints: interruptions in the
        work of the heart during the last 2 hours. severe shortness of breath when walking
   distance of at least 10 m), fatigue, severe general weakness.
        Anamnesis of the disease: Patient considers himself since 2008, when 3 weeks after the transferred lacunar
   angina for the first time developed a paroxysm of atrial fibrillation, complicated by the development of pulmonary edema.
    A military hospital was hospitalized, where acute infectious-immune myocarditis was diagnosed,
    carried out complex treatment. After discharge, the patient noted frequent attacks of palpitations (1-2 times a week),
   accompanied by severe general weakness, shortness of breath, dizziness. In view of this, in
   From 2008 to 2012, he was repeatedly hospitalized in various hospitals in St. Petersburg with par
   oxysms of atrial fibrillation (AF). The disease was complicated twice by the development of cardiogenic aritis.
   mic shock (2008 and 2009). In 2010, during the next hospitalization, thromboembolism was diagnosed
   pain in small branches of the pulmonary artery. On an outpatient basis, he received cordarone with an unstable effect. Activ
   The use of antiarrhythmic therapy was limited by the fact that against the background of intravenous cord injection
   Ron noted the development of toxic hepatitis with an increase in aminotransferases by more than 50 times (!), and
   ri oral use at a maintenance dose of 100 mg / day. - ALT level was within 2-3
    upper limits of normal. Use for long-term continuous use of drugs of group 1C does not cause
   tended to develop postmyocarditis remodeling and dilatation of the left chambers of the heart (diffuse hypo
   kinesia and myocardium, left ventricular ejection fraction 20%, dilatation anterior-posterior size of the left
   series 52 mm). In 2012, a protracted paroxysm of AF developed. Against this background, with daily monitoring of E
   CG recorded 88 episodes of non-sustained ventricular tachycardia (up to 10 sec.). FGBU "FTsSKE and
   me V.A. Almazov" on April 27, 2012, radiofrequency catheter isolation and catheter ablation of cava
   tricuspid isthmus under conditions of electroanatomical mapping CARTO 3 using a circular diagnostic electrode.
   When performing control endocardial electrophysio
   logical study, ventricular arrhythmias are not provoked, data for WPW syndrome were not obtained
   o, sinus rhythm is maintained, therapy with cordarone in combination with y-adrenergic blockers (bis
   prolol), however, already after three days on April 30, 2012, a hemodynamically significant paroxysm of AF
   developed again, which required the use of repeated electrical cardioversion. Despite the treatment
   No, during 2012-2013, paroxysms of the tachysystolic form of AF continued to be recorded, clinical
   cheski oligosymptomatic, which were stopped by intravenous administration of cordarone. In July 2014 against the backgro
    another paroxysm of AF, cardiogenic pulmonary edema developed, which required electrical
   and cardioversion for vital indications. For this reason, July 30, 2014 in the conditions of the Federal State Budgetary
   Institution "FTsSKE named after V.A. Almazov" repeated radiofrequency catheter ablation of arrhythmogenic zones of the le
   dserdium using a circular diagnostic electrode Lasso in conditions of electroanatomical
   th CartoXP mapping. This type of treatment made it possible to stabilize the patient's condition.
    and refuse to use cordarone until March 2015 (03/16/2015 resumed taking cordarone, due to
   in the development of recurrent episodes of an atypical form of atrial flutter, stopped stationary e
   electrical cardioversion). At the next examination of cardiac surgeons-arrhythmologists of the Federal State Budgetary
   Institution "FTsSKE named after V.A. Almazov", there were no indications for surgical treatment, it was recommended to contin

   administration and prophylactic administration of cordarone (according to the ECHO-ECG performed at that time against the background of dif

   In the case of myocardial hypokinesia, there was a decrease in EF to 18%). According to the patient, since the second half of 20

   edema in the legs began to increase, the abdomen increased in size, tolerance to physical activity decreased
   significantly, he began to get tired quickly, shortness of breath developed with slight physical exertion
  X. Associating deterioration of health with cordarone, the patient stopped taking it. During October-December
  In 2015, the patient regularly took diuretics (furosemide, veroshpiron), ACE inhibitors, but

   health and condition during the month of January progressively worsened: there was shortness of breath in the horizontal
   position, there were difficulties in moving around the apartment, in connection with which emergency medical

   according to indications, he was hospitalized in the intensive care unit of the hospital therapy clinic. Entrance
   After treatment with Levosimendan (2 doses), there was an improvement in well-being. After
   discharge from KGT developed paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, stopped by electrical cardioversion
   her in the Pokrovskaya hospital. During the same period, the patient was actively asked to join the queue for a transpl
  heart. On March 1, Levosimendan was re-introduced as planned. He followed the prescribed therapy at the
   outpatient stage and felt well. Despite this, at around 07:00 on April 21, 2016,
   the patient developed a paroxysm of atrial fibrillation, accompanied by a progressive increase in the expression
  female weakness, lowering blood pressure. Hospitalized in hospital hospital

   rapids.

     EXECUTIVE SUMMARY No.

         born 1971 was on inpatient examination and treatment with a diagnosis (I 40.0): Acute

    nal class.

   AT DISCHARGE: Patient with extremely high cardiovascular, arrhythmogenic and hemorrhagic risk. With
   the degree and severity of damage to the heart muscle does not determine the severity of the condition. Dominant
   the pathology of the liver is manifested by the development of cirrhosis, hepatosplenomegaly and severe hypoprotein
   inemia, which contributes to the development of significant edema, disruption of the coagulation link, the threat of developing tr
   ombo-hemorrhagic syndrome. The development of cirrhosis in a patient is indicated not only by structural changes
   liver disease, dilatation of the veins of the portal system, detected by ultrasound, but also a significant decrease in protein
   ovosynthetic function, a decrease in the level of calcium and magnesium in blood plasma. Given the nature and extent of
   myocardial changes, the contribution of cardiac dysfunction to the development of cirrhosis is minimal, which allows
   t is currently considered to be cryptogenic cirrhosis, and considering 10 points on the Child-Pugh scale, one can cons
   tat the decompensation of the course of cirrhosis without signs of portal hypertension (performed FGDS, in
   ultatation of which no data on the presence of varicose veins of the esophagus were obtained). Therefore, qi
   Rroz of the liver is currently the main contribution to the severity of the condition of the patient with the disease. Neoplastic
   process has not been proven. The results of the study of oncomarkers with positive
   m result and an increase of more than two times Gl 19-9 Ag (86.8 U / l), possibly determined by the presence of liver damage.
   The main efforts are focused on the normalization of the electrolyte and protein composition of the blood,

   thunderstorms of thrombo-hemorrhagic syndrome, decrease in the severity of tissue hyperhydration, hepatoprotection
   ivy therapy.

   ed only with the use of a ventilator. Their genesis, most likely, is of a mixed nature: due to m

    weakness, which does not allow the patient to independently carry out a full breath, diffuse pneumofib
   roses with the development of pronounced restrictive changes (which manifests itself, among other things, in a significant incre
   compliance of the lungs) and a decrease in the respiratory surface, as well as the presence of acute cardiovascular
   oh insufficiency, which aggravates the process of gas exchange in the alveoli, requiring constant maintenance of
   positive end-expiratory pressure. Damage to the heart is diffuse in nature with predominantly
   th damage to the lower wall. This damage contributes to some decrease in systolic function, however, in the
   development of heart failure, diastolic disorders after
   effect of fibrosis of the heart muscle.

   ubation was systematically transferred to VVL, insufflation with oxygen flow. Currently reached max
   the least possible compensation for pulmonary heart failure. The optimal therapy has been selected - but
   rmotension, respiratory rate less than 22/min, SaO2 when breathing atmospheric air 95-98%. Infrequent cr

   sloroda.

   disease, complete A-B blockade. In 2001, PEX was installed in DDD mode. In subsequent years,

   repeatedly treated in the clinics of the Military Medical Academy in connection with the emerging paroxysms of tachycardia, was diagnosed w

   b persistent atrial fibrillation. By 2013 progressive increase in heart failure

   troubled by shortness of breath, swelling of the lower extremities increased, at the same time, reimplantation of PEX was performed p

   in the DDD/e mode of the patient, combined aortic heart disease with a predominance of weeks was verified
   residual and 15.01.2014 in the clinic yyy-1 aortic valve prosthesis was performed biologically
   m prosthesis Edwards 25, as well as coronary angiography and arto-coronary bypass grafting (one bypass). (data abou

   ka in the form of relief of peripheral edema, a positive x-ray picture from the side of the lungs

   only a few days, and due to increasing edema, severe general weakness, shortness of breath, he was again
   hospitalized in the ICU of the hospital therapy clinic, where he was treated from June 2, 2016 to June 17, 2016.
   As a result of the examination, analysis of the obtained data, the diagnosis was established: Cree
   ptogenic cirrhosis of the liver, class C on the Child-Pugh scale. Chronic rheumatic, ischemic heart disease.
   Atherosclerosis of the aorta and coronary arteries. Atherosclerotic, myocardial cardiosclerosis

   c 5 points, HAS-BLED 6 points), complete AV blockade, PEX 2001, reimplantation 2013. in DDD mode (

   AT DISCHARGE: Patient of extremely high cardiovascular, arrhythmogenic risk. degree and pronounced
   The degree of damage to the heart muscle determines the severity of the condition in part. Patolo is dominant
   liver disease, manifested by the development of cirrhosis, hepatosplenomegaly and severe hypoproteinemia, which with
   contributes to the development of extremely severe edema, disruption of the coagulation link, the threat of developing thrombo-hemorrho
   ragic syndrome. The development of cirrhosis in a patient is indicated not only by structural changes in the liver
   , expansion of the veins of the portal system, detected by ultrasound, but also a significant decrease in protein-synthetic
   eskoy function, a decrease in the level of calcium and magnesium in blood plasma. Given the nature and extent of myocardial
   changes, the contribution of cardiac dysfunction to the development of cirrhosis is minimal, which allows us to
   its time to consider cirrhosis as cryptogenic, and considering 10 points on the Child-Pugh scale, one can state decompensation
   of the course of cirrhosis without signs of portal hypertension (an EGD was performed, as a result of
   some have not received data on the presence of varicose veins of the esophagus). Therefore, cirrhosis of the liver
    is currently the main contribution to the severity of the disease patient's condition. Neoplastic
   This process has not been proven. The results of the study of oncomarkers with a positive result
   m and an increase of more than two times Gl 19-9 Ag (86.8 U / l), possibly determined by the presence of damage to

      chewing gum.

   The main efforts are focused on the normalization of the electrolyte and protein composition of the blood,
   thunderstorms of thrombo-hemorrhagic syndrome, decrease in the severity of tissue hyperhydration, hepatoprotection
   ivy therapy.
   Discharged in a relatively satisfactory condition under the supervision of doctors of the clinic

    This block includes a number of mental disorders grouped together in relation to the presence of
other etiological factors, namely, the cause of these disorders were brain diseases, injuries
a brain or stroke leading to cerebral dysfunction. Dysfunction may be primary (to
as in diseases, brain injuries and strokes that directly or selectively affect the head
brain) and secondary (as in systemic diseases or disorders where the brain is involved
I am in the pathological process along with other organs and systems).

    Dementia [dementia] (F00-F03) is a syndrome caused by damage to the brain (usually chronic
of a progressive or progressive nature), in which many higher cortical functions are disturbed, including
including memory thinking, orientation, understanding, counting, learning ability, speech and judgment. conscious
it's not darkened. Decreased cognitive function is usually accompanied, and sometimes preceded, by worsen
lack of control over emotions, social behavior or motivation. This syndrome is observed in diseases
and Alzheimer's, in cerebrovascular diseases and in other conditions, primary or secondary lesions
brain.

    If necessary, an additional code is used to identify the underlying disease.

Discharged from the Military Medical                                A total of 15 days of treatment

Academy on September 20, 2017. The final diagnosis was

established on September 06, 2017. No disability certificate

was issued. Ability to work was not restored, observation / continued treatment / in specialization was recommended.

nnom pulmonology hospital Clinical

outcome: improvement.

     History of illness: The patient has a long history of hypertension (over 32 years). Since March 2017, he has
noted the appearance of an unmotivated unproductive cough and shortness of breath with moderate physical activity.
load. When seeking medical help, this condition was initially regarded as
reaction to taking ACE inhibitors, which are canceled without a positive effect. Subsequently, she noted an increase
e shortness of breath, decreased exercise tolerance and increased cough to hacking. Between 0
From August 3 to August 14, she was in the clinic of GT VMedA, where idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was verified.
Chronic subcompensated cor pulmonale. DN 1-2 tbsp. After starting to take methylprednisolone at a dose of 30
mg/day, she noted an increase in exercise tolerance, complete relief of cough. She has been deteriorating since
the end of August 2017, when she noted the appearance of a rare cough, increased dyspnea to the level of rest,
increased dryness in the mouth, the appearance of unmotivated thirst, rapid increase
and general weakness and fatigue. The above circumstances formed the basis for the appeal
for medical help.

     On admission September 06, 2017 complaints of severe general weakness (inability to stand), about
mixed breath at rest, aggravated with minimal physical exertion, moderate
cough with mucopurulent sputum of moderate volume, dry mouth and feeling of thirst, dry skin
skin, periodic swelling of the legs to the lower thirds of the legs.

     The general condition was regarded as severe, due to severe hyperglycemia (blood glucose 47 m
mol/l, urinary ketosis, in arterial blood, metabolic acidosis is compensated by respiratory alkalosis), severe
hypoalbuminemia (23 g/l) and hypoproteinemia (46 g/l), severe peripheral hypoperfusion
tissues against the background of hypovolemia (CVP negative. BP with a tendency to hypotension 90-105 / 50-70 mmHg, tachyka
up to 115/min, signs of acute damage to a single kidney, oliguria), respiratory failure
stuy (RR 28-36/min; SaO2 when breathing atmospheric air 86%, against the background of insufflation with a flow of oxyg
ode 5 l / min 95%), expressed by general muscle weakness.

     Against the background of ongoing therapy on September 11, vomiting appeared with small flakes of hematin, with F
attention was paid to diapedetic bleeding from the surface of the mucous membrane and single small erosions of the
stomach. Considering a significant decrease in hemoglobin to 60 g / l (including against the background of hemodilution due
ion therapy in the previous days in the treatment of hyperglycemia) and hypocoagulation, a transfusion was performed
one-group [A2B (IV) Rh (-) det. Kell (-) det. dCchyy] blood, plasma, albumin.

     During the treatment, stabilization of hemodynamics was achieved at the level of normotension, sinus
th normosystole, subcompensated respiratory failure (when breathing with atmospheric air y SaO2 95-98%),
glycemia compensation (6.0-10.0 mmol / l), kidney function compensated (diuresis adekva
ten of water load without additional stimulation), hypoperfusion and hypovolemia were stopped, the severity of
general weakness was partially reduced. At the control CT of the lungs (on the arms) there are signs of subtotal
al damage by idiopathic fibrosing alveolitis.

     Currently in the further stay in the conditions of the intensive care unit and intensive care
does not need. Further treatment under the supervision of a pulmonologist.


         The patient is shown to continue GCS therapy in the amount of 4.5 tablets of methylprednisolone per day (in the morning
   , under the guise of antacids and secretolytics), oxygen therapy on an ongoing basis through concentrate
   r, breathing exercises with PEEP, nebulizer therapy (berodual 10 drops, ambroxol 20 drops, physio-r 1
    ml - 2 times a day), measures to normalize the nutritional status, support carbohydrate metabolism,
   activization of the patient. A further systematic reduction in the dose of metipred is possible in the regimen of 0.5 tablets per week.
   The use of efferent therapy methods is currently unlikely due to the high risk
   and bleeding, hypoalbuminemia. Inspection of the pulmonologist in dynamics.
