   mg/l. PSA from 10/11/2017: 0.05 ng/mL (norm 0.00-4.00). Procalcitonin from
   10/07/2017: 0.648 ng/ml (normal 0-0.1 ng/ml, more than 0.1 ng/ml - bacterial infection is possible,
    more than 0.5 ng/ml - high risk of sepsis, from 10/23/2017: 0.074 ng/ml, from 10/26/2017: 0.13 ng/ml.
   Proteinogram dated October 11, 2017: albumin 51.53% (norm 55.8-65); y-1 6.0% (norm 2.2-4.6); y-2 14.06% (n
   form 8.2-12.5); y 11.85% (7.2-14.2); y 16.56% (11.5-18.6). The
   results of sputum culture (obtained at FBS dated 10/06/2017): 1. Acinetobacter baumanii (sensitive to ampicillin,
   amikacin, gentamicin, levofloxacin, trimethoprim/sulfamethaxazole, cefepime, cyp
   rofloxacin; intermediate to meronem); 2. Escherichia coli (sensitive to amikacin, intermediate to
    gentamicin, meronem); 3. Klebsiella pneumonia (resistance to all antibacterial drugs). Sputum culture dated October
   24, 2017 (received with FBS): 1. Klebsiella pneumonia; 2. Enterococcus faecalis. 3. Yeast
   fungi of the genus Candida. Culture addition: Klebsiella pneumonia produces carbapenemase: met
   alo-betalactamase NDM. Sensitive to tetracycline, tigecycline, colistin, fosfomycin, bacteria
   ophag Klebsiella polyvalent. Urine culture
   results dated October 27, 2017: Klebsiella pneumonia (sensitive to amikacin, gentamicin, then
   bramycin; intermediate sensitivity to imipenem and meropenem). Addendum: Enter Growth Revealed
   obater cloacae sensitive to tigecycline. The
   results of blood culture from 10/27/2017: growth of Staphylococcus epidermidis was
   obtained. Biochemical examination of the pleural fluid (right pleural cavity) 10/31/17: total protein 20
    g/l, ALT 10 units/l.
   Biochemical examination of the pleural fluid (left pleural cavity) 10/31/17: total protein 21 g
   / l, ALT 7 ED / l.

   COURSE OF THE DISEASE IN THE CLINIC OF HOSPITAL THERAPY:


  On the part of the main organs and systems (cardiovascular, respiratory systems), the patient was
  compensated during the first day, the therapy selected at the previous stages of treatment was
  adjusted within the framework of the underlying and concomitant diseases. Stabilization of
  hemodynamics was confirmed during daily monitoring of ECG and blood pressure. During the
  examination, ultrasound of the abdomen and small pelvis confirmed a polyp of the gallbladder, a
  violation of the rheology of bile, diffuse changes in the pancreas, thickening of the PCS and cysts of
  both kidneys, as well as signs of chronic cystitis, diverticulum (formation?) of the bladder, the
  condition after subtotal resection of prostate adenoma. At the initial X-ray examination, there were no
  signs of hydrothorax, no infiltrative changes were detected. However, CT revealed a picture of
  interstitial changes in the lungs of a congestive nature against the background of COPD (pulmonary
  emphysema, signs of bronchitis, pneumofibrotic changes). Gon's foci, calcified lymph nodes of the
  right bronchopulmonary group, calcifications along the pleura on the right - posttuberculous changes.
  A small amount of fluid in the pleural cavity and pericardial cavity. Degenerative-dystrophic changes
  in the thoracic spine, as well as mixed substitutive hydrocephalus of the brain. In order to clarify the
  nature of changes in the spine due to pain vertebrogenic syndrome, an x-ray examination of the chest
  was performed, which revealed static disturbances in the form of straightening of the physiological
  lordosis and displacement of the bodies L3 posteriorly by 0.7 cm and L5 anteriorly and by 0.9 cm
  (ladder listhesis) . Decrease in body height L1 with its wedge-shaped deformation due to a compression
  fracture. Osteochondrosis L2-3, L3-4, L4-5 motor segments with symptoms of spondylosis. Diffuse
  osteoporosis. In the blood tests, the decrease in the level of protein, urea, and cholesterol was
  explained not only by alimentary causes, but also by a decrease in catabolic processes. From the
  moment of admission, the clinical picture was dominated by pain syndrome caused by ertebrogenic
  pathology (degenerative-dystrophic disease of the thoracic and lumbar spine. Spondyloarthrosis.
  Osteochondrosis of the lumbar spine with L2-L5. Compression uncomplicated stable fracture of the
  L1 vertebral body (of unknown age) with pain and radicular syndromes) against the background of
  neurological deficit. Due to severe pain and radicular syndromes, the patient is constantly in a forced
  horizontal position on the back, which increases the risk of developing vicarious complications:
  congestive pneumonia, thromboembolic catastrophes, soft tissue necrosis, progression of constipation
  events. He was consulted by a neurologist ("Acute lumbodynia, possibly of vertebrogenic origin.
  cerebrovascular disease, stage II encephalopathy with vertebrobasilar insufficiency and moderate
  cognitive impairment") and an orthopedist. The ongoing therapeutic measures, according to the
  principle of reasonableness and sufficiency, were aimed not only at the secondary prevention of life-
  threatening precedents, but also at improving the quality of life. Flupirtine, a non-opioid centrally
  acting analgesic, is used as symptomatic therapy for pain syndrome; it was decided to refrain from
  NSAIDs (taking into account the high risk of nephrotoxicity and bleeding). In addition, the patient was
  examined by the Chief Specialist of the Military Medical Academy for physical therapy, and a course
  of exercise therapy was started. On October 06, 2017, during a planned round of the ward, attention
  was drawn to the patient's drowsiness, does not respond to sound and tactile stimuli, and reacts to
  pain impulses. Due to a sharp increase in neurological deficit, a high risk of developing hypostatic,
  aspiration pneumonia, the need for dynamic monitoring of vital functions, as well as in order to
  eliminate and prevent life-threatening conditions, the patient was transferred to the ICU. In the ICU, the
  neurologist ruled out stroke, diagnosed Parkinson's syndrome, which was successfully compensated
  by PK-Merz injections, as well as congestive pneumonia in the basal parts of the lungs. FBS was
  performed (deformation of the lumen of the middle third of the trachea due to external compression,
  deformation of the right main bronchus and left bronchus due to external compression along the
  medial wall, chronic diffuse deforming endobronchitis, exacerbation) were determined. In view of the
  development of nosocomial pneumonia, an analysis of washing water was taken, in which a multidrug-
  resistant strain of Klebsiella pneumonia, Acinetobacter baumanii was identified (06.10.2017). Against
  the background of the treatment, by October 10, a moderate positive effect was achieved in the form
  of achieving the target indicators of the work of internal organs against the background of pronounced age

  Senile lesions of the central nervous system and signs of sarcopenia with the development of muscle
  weakness and age-related dementia remained dominant in the picture of the disease. Patient for
  comprehensive care, regular external monitoring of prescribed medications, prophylaxis

   tics of bedsores and congestion (regular frequent change in body position in bed, percussion
   massage, conducting a course of exercise therapy) was transferred to the cardiology
   department. The course of the disease was characterized by a progressive increase in the phenomena of encephalopathy in the
   nic brain disease of mixed genesis with severe cognitive impairment, hygienic
   proteinemia and hypoalbuminemia, sarco- and dynamopenia, intoxication syndrome, which manifested itself in the form of
   reinforcing the day-night inversion (wakefulness between 15:00-04:00) and signs of dementia, an increase in the
   severity of general weakness, congestion in the basal parts of the lungs, the appearance of subfebrile l
   fever, hemodynamic tendencies to hypotension, decubitus ulcers of the calcaneal areas (the appearance of cyanosis of the
   16.10, examined by a surgeon on 17.10 - "forming bedsores" were verified). As a symptom
   transfusion of two doses of albumin was performed. Changes in urine sediment were associated with the presence
   of an epicystostomy, the toilet of which was performed daily. Despite the relative stability
    patient in general therapeutic terms, high risks of life-threatening nosocomial
   th complications. The combination of a high risk of developing life-threatening thromboembolism (PADUA scale = 7
   points) and an equally low risk of bleeding (H. DECOSUS scale = 12.5 points) predetermined the person
   lysed approach to antithrombotic therapy. Severe cognitive impairment prevented from conducting endoscopic
   studies. Given the extremely high risk of falls (HENDRIK II = 6 points
   c), an individual medical and nursing post was created, the location of the patient as much as possible
   my place from the alarm call button, lowering the height of the bed to the minimum allowable level,
   ruzhenie bed sides. During the entire hospitalization, both the current and the final
   infection.
   However, despite the entire sector of medical and nursing activities, during a planned round of the ward,
    attention to the increasing drowsiness of the patient, does not respond to sound and tactile stimuli, to more
   the left impulse reacts. Due to a sharp increase in neurological deficit, a high risk of developing hypostatic, aspiration
   pneumonia, the need for dynamic monitoring in
   vital functions, as well as in order to eliminate and prevent life-threatening conditions October 18 pa
   The patient was again transferred to the intensive care unit. On admission to
   the ICU, the patient's condition was severe. Consciousness is depressed to the level of a deep stupor, con
   tact with the patient is difficult. The severity of the condition is determined by the increasing phenomena of multiple organ (
   chnoy, cardiac, respiratory, cerebral), predominantly respiratory failure in polymorb
   of a typical senile patient on the background of nosocomial pneumonia. Skin is pale, dry
   e, hematomas at the injection sites, multiple subcutaneous hematomas of the extremities. Visible mucous membranes
   you, pale. In the heel region, on both sides, at the place of contact with the mattress, there are emerging
   I have bedsores with a diameter of about 5 cm. Peripheral lymph nodes are not enlarged. The musculoskeletal system
   with signs of severe sarcopenia. hypoproteinemic edema is formed on the lower surface of the body
   . Pulse 60 in 1 min, low filling and tension, rhythmic. Left border of the heart along the left mid-clavicular line. BP
   95/65 mmHg Art. Heart sounds are muffled, rhythmic, systolic murmur at the top
   ke heart of moderate intensity. Breathing is hard, weakened in the lower parts, there is also a moderate if
   the number of congestive rales against the background of a moderate amount of dry rales over all fields of the lungs. Frequency
   breaths 22 in 1 min. SaO2 98% against the background of constant insufflation with humidified oxygen. The tongue is wet
   covered with a whitish coating. The abdomen is soft, painless in all departments. Liver, spleen not enlarged
   s. Tapping on the lumbar region is painful on both sides, more on the right due to disease along
   spine. Urination through epicystostomy. From the
   moment of admission, the condition steadily worsened - the phenomena of respiratory failure increased.
   and, general intoxication, hypoproteinemia and hemostasis disorders. In the washing water of the bronchi, the floor is sown
   and resistant strain of Klebsiella pneumonia, as well as Acinetobacter baumanii, Enterococcus faecalis, in urine and
   gkih - candida albicans. Based on primary culture, ceftaroline was prescribed (susceptibility unknown).
   tna) and levofloxacin (susceptible to Acinetobacter baumanii), as well as inhaled Colistin and Dioxidin. As an
   antimycotic therapy - fluoknazol 200 mg / day + bladder lavage. It was determined that hypoproteinemia is of a
   mixed nature. The main contribution is made by heavy protein synthet
   ical dysfunction of the liver (senile and infectious dystrophy and fibrosis in combination with
   radial fibrosis). In addition, there is a high protein catabolism (including gluconeogenesis) in
   conditions of an active immune response against the background of an infectious process, which leads to a rapid breakdown
   excreted albumin/plasma proteins and progressive saturation of the interstitial space with fluid
   with an increase in hypoproteinemic edema. This forms the ineffectiveness of substitution therapy and

  albumin in low doses and increases the concentration of drugs, including antibacterial and antim
   icotic agents in plasma. The use of antibacterial agents in the absence of adequate
   o drainage of the terminal part of the tracheobronchial tree predetermines the extremely low effectiveness of
   antibiotic therapy and forms the resistance of the systemic edematous syndrome and congestive manifestations
   ions in the lungs. Frequent absence of coagulation according to the result of a coagulogram, an increase in subcutaneous hemorrho
   logical manifestations, along with severe hypoproteinemia (low levels of globulins, proteins of the co-
   agulation against the background of liver protein synthesis insufficiency) required correction of the hemostasis system
   The drug of choice in this situation was determined to be fresh frozen plasma as a medium with a wide range of
   plasma proteins and the most suitable option for "prosthetics" of the disorders that take place. Complementary
   but albumin infusions were performed to replenish and normalize oncotic pressure, to bring the
   pharmacodynamics of the administered drugs to the target value. In view of the persistence of fever, a control
   R-gram of the chest was performed on 10/23/2017. on which congestion in the lungs increased. Increased
  amount of fluid in the pleural cavities with a tendency to wasp
   micromanagement. Pneumonic infiltration persists in the lower parts of the lungs. October 24, 2017
   sanation-diagnostic bronchoscopy was completed. Due to the ineffectiveness of antibiotic therapy for
   on the basis of culture data on the sensitivity of microorganisms to antibiotics, ceft was replaced
  rolin to linezolid, inhaled amikacin was prescribed. After
   3 days, despite the change in antibiotic therapy, fever persisted, indicating a
   active infectious process. In the result of sowing wash water, polyresiste was determined
   nt strain of Klebsiella pneumonia (produces metallo-beta-lactamase NMD) with the presence of sensitivity
   and to polyvalent Klebsiella bacteriophage, fosfomycin, colistin, tetracycline, taigecycline.
    In view of the absence of the academy of fosfomycin and bacteriophage in the supply service and pharmacy network, it was decided
   the decision to increase the dose of administered Colistin up to 4 times a day. Given the resistance of the flora to amika
   inu (according to culture), its toxicity, as well as the systemic toxicity of levofloxacin, a decision was made
   stop further use of these drugs. Doses of administered Colistin increased up to 4 times per day
  ducks with its additional introduction intrabronchially when performing fibrobronchoscopy. As part of
   complex antibiotic therapy retained fosfomycin, linezolid, human polyvalent and
   immunoglobulin.
   In addition, the fact of sowing yeast-like fungi of the genus Candida ssp. in sputum and in large quantities in
   urine (urine culture was taken with the determination of sensitivity to antimycotics) indicated the formation of a system
   a lot of mycosis against the background of a systemic immunosuppressive state, and the detection of Candida ssp. after freq
   o flushing of the urinary tract with fluconazole, along with their systemic use at a dose of 200 mg / s
  ut dictated the urgent need to change the antimycotic drug and conduct systemic therapy. The loading dose of
   voriconazole was reduced due to both toxic effects and low albumin levels.
   and excretory function of the kidneys (low creatinine is a reflection of a low rate
   glomerular filtration, but as a result of severe sarcopenia), which creates the prerequisites for a higher
   concentration of the drug in the blood. Additionally, treatment of the exit site to the abdominal wall of the epicystosto
   we are dermazin.
   The change in antibiotic therapy did not affect the course of the disease - in the next three days
  There was fever and respiratory failure, and there was a rapid decrease in the previously administered protein. what t
  required its correction.
   As a result of sowing the wash water, a strain of Klebsiella pneumonia was sown (produces metallo beta-
   lactamase NMD) with sensitivity to the polyvalent Klebsiella bacteriophage, phosph
   omycin, colistin, tetracycline, tigecycline. Due to the ineffectiveness of the ongoing complex antiba
   treatment with all antibiotics available at the VMedA, a decision was made on the vital
   th indications, in view of the direct threat to the life of the patient, to ask the leadership of the academy to purchase tigecycli
   the use of this drug in hospital-acquired pneumonia caused by carbapenemasoproducing
   Klebsiella pneumonia, defined by the National Guidelines (Nosocomial pneumonia in adults
   donkeys: Russian national recommendations / ed. B.R. Gelfand; resp. ed. D.N. Protsenko, B.Z. Bel
   ocherkovskiy. - 2nd ed., revised. and additional - Moscow: Medical Information Agency, 2016. - 176 p. [c.
    133]).
   During a chest x-ray on October 30, 2017. in the horizontal position of the patient in the conditions of the ICU
   without holding the breath, a pronounced negative trend was determined with a significant
   an increase in the amount of encysted fluid, especially on the right and subtotal infiltration of the right l

   mild uneven nature, which does not exclude abscessing. Pleural empyema? Immediately you
  full of CT-chest. Data for the presence of pleural empyema and abscess pneumonia was not received. Revealed
   bilateral middle hydrothorax with compression of the lower lobes of both lungs. The patient was evacuated
  pleural fluid. Against the
  background of initiated therapy with tigecycline, a day later, body temperature returned to normal, decreased
   the severity of respiratory failure. Antibacterial therapy adjusted - introduced
   a Tigecycline (Tygacil 50 mg 2 times a day), inhaled Colistin (4 million units / day) and Dioxidine (80 mg / day
   t).
   In the obtained analysis of urine culture on November 01, the growth of Klebsiella pneumonia was detected. Stated to convin
  no evidence for ongoing urinary and respiratory tract candidiasis, voricon therapy
  terminated with evil. Due to the low level of potassium, its correction was initiated with a constant infusion of 4%
  thief through the
  dispenser. Against the background of ongoing therapy, to date, there has been a positive trend in the form of norma
  function of external respiration, central hemodynamics, stabilization of body temperature, improvement in

   fiery phenomena.

  AT DISCHARGE:
  An elderly patient with symptoms of multiple organ failure. Conducting complex therapy
  I, aimed at achieving stable relief of inflammation in the urinary system and respiratory tract caused by
  Klebsiella pneumonia, Enterobater cloacae sensitive to tigecycline (chicken
   completed with antibiotic therapy). Active anti-decubitus measures made it possible to prevent
  prevent the occurrence of new bedsores, and the use of iodine-based drugs significantly improve the condition
   decubitus ulceration of the heel areas.
  In blood tests, signs of respiratory alkalosis are determined, which is predominantly central
  ny genesis (deep breathing without tachypnea, Kussmaul type episodes). Most likely. this is neg
   aggravation of severe metabolic disorders of microcirculation and phenomena of renal insufficiency. During
  sleep, the nature of breathing changes to Grokk, most likely due to severe atherosclerosis of the vascular
  in the brain. Therapy was prescribed to correct the identified disorders. The senile
  lesion of the central nervous system remains dominant in the picture of the disease.
  symptoms of sarcopenia with the development of muscle weakness and immobility, age-related dementia,
   which largely determines the development of complications. The patient needs comprehensive care, regular
  external monitoring of the prescribed medication
  remedies, prevention of bedsores and congestion - regular frequent changes in body position

   while in bed, percussion massage, exercise therapy

  RECOMMENDED: 1.
   continue treatment in the conditions of the possibility of providing auxiliary medical care and care. 2. Strict
  observance of anti-decubitus measures!!! 3. Continue the course of selected therapy: - Omeprazole 40 mg
   - intravenously in the morning - PK-Merz 0.1 - 2 capsules in the morning and 1 capsule at 18:00 -
   Spironolactone 25 mg - 1 tablet 2 times a day - Symbicort 160/45 mcg - 1 dose 2 times a day - Linex - 2
   capsules 3 times a day - Through a nebulizer: · Colistin 1 million units - 2 times a day for a week · Dioxidin
   2 ml (dilute 2 times with saline sodium chloride solution ) 3 times a day · Ambroxol 2 ml (dilute 2 times with
   saline sodium chloride solution) 2 times a day - Dermazin ointment - treatment of the exit area of the urinary
   catheter - Brownadin - treatment of the heel area 2 times a day 4. Daily toilet of the skin around the catheter
   with solutions of antiseptics, change of aseptic sticker; hepa

  rinovy "lock" at the end of each infusion. 5.
   Control of the level of total protein, albumin, coagulogram 1 time in 3 days. Correction as needed
